mdRecord.dcterms:description: The building served as a state capitol until the new capitol building was constructed in 1912. Used for various purposes until 1947 when the General Assembly approved acts designating the State House as a museum. The building underwent major renovation in 1996, and was designated a National Historic Landmark in 1997. The building continues to serve as a museum with exhibits related to Arkansas history and culture. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Old_State_House_(Little_Rock,_Arkansas) [work]
